summary: David Tennant has recently spoken to ABC's Popcorn about his new US comedy series Camping, which sees him play henpecked husband...
caption: David Tennant has recently spoken to ABC’s Popcorn about his new US comedy series Camping, which sees him play henpecked husband Walt to Jennifer Garner’s highly strung Kathryn. The unhappily married pair embark on a camping trip with a group of pals to celebrate Walt’s birthday and comedy chaos enuses. David also talks to host, Peter Travers, about Doctor Who and stage fright.

David also talks to host, Peter Travers, about Doctor Who and stage fright.

blog.name: cleowho
blog.title: Flight Through Eternity
blog.description:
Classic Doctor Who / Contemporary Doctor Who blog by Chloe "Cleo" Mortimer.
British fan girl and obsessive Whonatic. Tweets @CleoWho
All posts created exclusively by me unless they're marked as reblogs. Expect SPOILERS, because you can't enthuse over fifty years of a TV show and keep everything that's happened a secret.
Comments and opinions are entirely my own. Original text entries are copyright (c) Chloe Mortimer.

summary: Recording of the Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead Fast sketch (By Tom Richards with apologies to Stoppard and Shakespeare)...
track_name: Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead Fast
caption:
Recording of the Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead Fast sketch (By Tom Richards with apologies to Stoppard and Shakespeare) David Tennant took a small part in together with Tom Richards, James Utechin and Isabel Ogilvie-Smith. 

David only makes a very small appearance - short, but still rather great! Though, once again, audio alone doesn’t do it justice at all. Looking slightly rumpled (as in the picture) he came rushing unto the stage trying to get rid of his Ophelia - saying his lines for then to rush off stage on the other side, leaving her behind.

Not exactly Hamlet as in Hamlet, but a Hamlet none the less - and maybe only for a few precious seconds, but still! I have definitely witnessed him play Hamlet on stage now :D

blog.name: rants-ofthehighestorder
blog.title: I’m Opinionated Let It Happen
blog.description: Can I even write | icon credit: @padawanlost | please go check out my writing blog @isurehopeicanwrite !!

summary: Doctor Who: The Love of my Life
body:
Doctor Who: The Love of my Life

I started watching Doctor Who in the seventh grade. I started with lovely, under appreciated Christopher Eccleston, who was a powerhouse of angst just in time for me to be my depressed teenage self.

He is super important to me. His Doctor, the power behind him, the kindness, the love, all of it is so important to me. I fell in love with the character of the Doctor through Eccleston. He seemed to embody everything that the Doctor is, strong and kind and helpful and loving and dangerous and hurt and hopeful. I love him. And then Tennant came, and I mean…

Does it get much better? He’s just as important to me as Eccleston is, simply because of the God-given emotional range David Tennant has. His acting honestly deserves a post of its own (which I will probably make happen). His Doctor is powerful and finally admitting to what the Doctor does, how the Doctor lives. He’s the actor that slowly makes the transition to coming to terms with who the Doctor is and what the Doctor has done.

AND NOW.

This is not going to turn into a Matt Smith appreciation post, even though he’s my favorite Doctor (yes I’m aware I’m in the minority there), but I have to shout out how important his portrayal of the Doctor is to the canon and character development. If the Doctor hadn’t had playtime, they couldn’t have been the angry old man that Capaldi brought to the table (Yes, I referred to them as “they”. Please refer to Travis McElroy for a reason why. There’s a lot and it’s super valid and when referring to the Doctor as all of their character and not one specific incarnation, I refer to them as “they”. Moving on.).

Peter Capadi was the boost that the show needed to be a powerhouse and not just a monster-of-the-week anymore. To be fair, that started with Tennant, but Capaldi made it happen. I’m not ignoring the glaring issues that I have with those seasons (I hate Clara don’t @me) but I l o v e Capaldi.

I cannot pass judgement on Jodie yet, I haven’t seen any of her episodes (I’m working on it don’t yell at me) but as soon as I do, I will share my feelings for the world.

I love Doctor Who. Doctor Who is the most important media form in my life. And that’s not gonna change anytime soon.
